qas.question: What position did Larry Lamb take with the Sun?
What type of view did Lamb have of the Mirror?
What did Lamb and Murdoch believe to be the best indicator of newspaper quality?
What position did Lamb formerly hold at the Mirror?
How many reporters did Lamb hire for the Mirror's initial staff?

context: Murdoch found he had such a rapport with Larry Lamb over lunch that other potential recruits as editor were not interviewed and Lamb was appointed as the first <a0_0>editor<a0_0/> of the new Sun. He was <a1_0>scathing<a1_0/> in his opinion of the Mirror, where he had recently been employed as a <a3_0>senior sub-editor<a3_0/>, and shared Murdoch's view that a paper's quality was best measured by <a2_0>its sales<a2_0/>, and he regarded the Mirror as overstaffed, and primarily aimed at an ageing readership. Lamb hastily recruited a staff of <a4_0>about 125<a4_0/> reporters, who were mostly selected for their availability rather than their ability.
